label: Acidity
definition: sharp, crisp flavor that contributes to wine freshness

label: Aftertaste
definition: the taste or flavors that linger in the mouth after wine is tasted, spit or swallowed

label: Age/Aging
definition: to let get older in controlled conditions to improve flavor. all wine is aged from a few weeks to a few decades.

label: Approachable
definition: easy, drinkable wine

label: Aromatic
definition: a wine's scent; a floral scent or spiciness

label: Attractive
definition: a lighter style, fresh and easy to drink

label: Balance
definition: the ability to producing wine blended without one grape or component upstaging another

label: Beefy
definition: a term used to describe red wines, such as cabernet sauvignon

label: Big
definition: a wine loaded with tannins and concentrated fruits

label: Bouquet
definition: the scent or "nose" of the wine

label: Buttery
definition: the aroma of a glass of wine

label: Chewy
definition: wine with plenty of tannins and fruits

label: Clean
definition: simple and direct, without chemical or bacterial fruit

label: Complex
definition: intense wine with undertones of a variety of flavors

label: Crisp
definition: generous acidity found in clean and fresh wines, like chardonnay

label: Deep
definition: describes wines with a full flavor

label: Developed
definition: refers to the maturity of a wine

label: Dry
definition: no trace or taste of sweetness or residual sugar

label: Dusty
definition: used to describe hot country red winesdef: earthy the smell of robust minerals

label: Fat
definition: a weight and mildly clumsy wine

label: Finish
definition: the taste that a wine leaves on the tongue

label: Flinty
definition: describes the fragrance or taste of some white wines, especially white bordeaux

label: Freshness
definition: a nice acidity with traces of fruit or floral

label: Fruity
definition: the aroma or flavor of grapes and other fruits like black currant, apple, plum or strawberry

label: Fullness
definition: the body, weight or feel of a wine

label: Grapy
definition: a rare flavor of grape

label: Green
definition: a light wine with an unripe, tart taste

label: Hard
definition: red wines with extra tannins, commonly found in young reds

label: Heady
definition: used to describe a wine high in alcohol

label: Herbaceous
definition: the taste and smell of herbs in wine

label: Honeyed
definition: describes ripe wines, which usually have a sweet aroma or taste of honey

label: Jammy
definition: cooked, sweetish red wines

label: Late Harvest
definition: wine made from grapes that were allowed to hang on the vine until their sugar content was very high, producing a sweet wine

label: Length
definition: the flavor that lingers in the mouth after swallowing

label: Mouthfeel
definition: how a wine feels in your mouth and against the tongue

label: Neutral
definition: describes a wine without any outstanding characteristics, but without any particularly bad ones either

label: Nutty
definition: a delicate of hazelnut or nutmeg flavordef: oaky hints of mild sweet vanilla from fermentation in oak barrels

label: Oxidized
definition: wine overexposed to air

label: Plumy
definition: the fruity flavor found in big reds

label: Prickly
definition: a wine with a residual effect

label: Racy
definition: a vivid, but light wine with acidity

label: Round
definition: describes a wine with a good balance of fruit and tannins, with good body

label: Short
definition: describes a wine that does not remain on the palate after swallowing (see "finish")

label: Silky
definition: a well-rounded, smooth tasting residue after swallowing

label: Smoky
definition: an undertone of smokiness, specifically when matured in moderately charred oak barrels

label: Soft
definition: mellow, well-balanced wine with mature tannins and low acidity

label: Spicy
definition: hints of peppermint, cinnamon in red wines and fruity with a zest in white wines

label: Steely
definition: a crispy, dry metallic flavor

label: Supple
definition: matured tannins with soft textures

label: Sweet
definition: describes the richness or ripeness in a quality wine

label: Tannins
definition: adds dryness and astringency

label: Tart
definition: an unripe, green wine

label: Toasty
definition: the taste and smell of oak-fermented barrels

label: Tough
definition: implies excessive tannins

label: Vanilla
definition: the scent of new oak

label: Velvety
definition: smooth wine where the grape blend is undetectable
